title: Language-Based Experiential Learning and Mentoring Program for Strengthening Real-World Business Communication Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Basic business administration concepts, professional experience, and foundational business document creation/presentation skills (grammar, vocabulary, basic expression techniques)
context.additional_context: Learners are general citizens with practical experience in various industries, aiming to bridge the gap between management theory and practice. Focuses on enhancing job performance efficiency through improved business communication skills (document writing, presentations, negotiations, etc.), with a particular emphasis on strengthening linguistic competencies (text analysis, vocabulary expansion, expression techniques).

learning_goals: Learners can analyze real-world business cases to develop data-driven decision-making reports and presentation skills, effectively utilizing the logical structure and specialized vocabulary of business texts.

Through collaboration with peers and mentors, learners can establish project-based problem-solving strategies, enhance grammatical accuracy and expression in business documents (proposals, plans, etc.), and execute effective expression strategies considering the audience during oral presentations.

Over two weeks on an online learning platform, learners can establish weekly study plans (time allocation, goal setting), submit weekly learning journals (recorded at least three times) and quiz results (scores above 70%) to perform self-directed learning management and performance evaluation. Additionally, they can comprehensively improve language proficiency through business writing (document structure, vocabulary selection) and presentation evaluations (pronunciation, intonation, nonverbal expression).
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
